name: GqlQuery
title: Gcloud
Datastore
GqlQuery
description:
Query

Represents a GQL query.

GQL is a SQL-like language for retrieving entities or keys from Datastore.

examples.code:
gql_query = Gcloud::Datastore::GqlQuery.new
gql_query.query_string = "SELECT * FROM Task ORDER BY created ASC"
tasks = datastore.run gql_query

methods.name: query_string
title: Gcloud
Datastore
GqlQuery#query_string
methods.description: The GQL query string for the query. The string may contain named or positional argument binding sites that start with @. Corresponding binding values should be set with #named_bindings= or #positional_bindings=.

methods.name: query_string=
title: Gcloud
Datastore
GqlQuery#query_string=
methods.description:
Sets the GQL query string for the query. The string may contain named or positional argument binding sites that start with @. Corresponding binding values should be set with #named_bindings= or #positional_bindings=.

See the GQL Reference.

examples.code:
gql_query = Gcloud::Datastore::GqlQuery.new
gql_query.query_string = "SELECT * FROM Task " \
                         "WHERE done = @done AND priority = @priority"
gql_query.named_bindings = {done: false, priority: 4}

methods.name: allow_literals
title: Gcloud
Datastore
GqlQuery#allow_literals
methods.description: Whether the query may contain literal values. When false, the query string must not contain any literals and instead must bind all values using #named_bindings= or #positional_bindings=.

returns.description: true if the query may contain literal values

methods.name: allow_literals=
title: Gcloud
Datastore
GqlQuery#allow_literals=
methods.description: Sets whether the query may contain literal values. When false, the query string must not contain any literals and instead must bind all values using #named_bindings= or #positional_bindings=.

examples.code:
gql_query = Gcloud::Datastore::GqlQuery.new
gql_query.query_string = "SELECT * FROM Task " \
                         "WHERE completed = false AND priority = 4"
gql_query.allow_literals = true

params.name: new_allow_literals
params.description: true if the query may contain literal values

methods.name: named_bindings
title: Gcloud
Datastore
GqlQuery#named_bindings
methods.description: The named binding values for a query that contains named argument binding sites that start with @.

returns.description:
a frozen hash that maps the binding site names in the
query string to valid GQL arguments

methods.name: named_bindings=
title: Gcloud
Datastore
GqlQuery#named_bindings=
methods.description: Sets named binding values for a query that contains named argument binding sites that start with @.

examples.code:
gql_query = Gcloud::Datastore::GqlQuery.new
gql_query.query_string = "SELECT * FROM Task " \
                         "WHERE done = @done AND priority = @priority"
gql_query.named_bindings = {done: false, priority: 4}

params.name: new_named_bindings
params.description:
a hash that maps the binding site names
in the query string to valid GQL arguments

methods.name: positional_bindings
title: Gcloud
Datastore
GqlQuery#positional_bindings
methods.description: The binding values for a query that contains numbered argument binding sites that start with @.

returns.description:
a frozen array containing the query arguments in the
order of the numbered binding sites in the query string

methods.name: positional_bindings=
title: Gcloud
Datastore
GqlQuery#positional_bindings=
methods.description: Sets the binding values for a query that contains numbered argument binding sites that start with @.

examples.code:
gql_query = Gcloud::Datastore::GqlQuery.new
gql_query.query_string = "SELECT * FROM Task" \
                         "WHERE completed = @1 AND priority = @2"
gql_query.positional_bindings = [false, 4]

params.name: new_positional_bindings
params.description:
query arguments in the order
of the numbered binding sites in the query string
